The number of people holding more than o: 2. The rate of employed people who hold multiple jobs was 4.9 percent in June, slightly lower than the 5.1 rate when unemployment peaked at 10 percent during the Great Recession.
Employed people: whether they hold one or more jobs, are only counted once in the unemployment rate calculation.
Having two jobs doesn: t make someone count twice in the unemployment rate calculation because the classification is done by individual.
